LABEL: AL rdfs:label@en
IAO definition: AL IAO:0000115@en
linkml description: AL linkml:description@en
comments: AL linkml:comments@en
data_collection_state: AT data_collection_state^^xsd:string

LABEL: specimen collector sample ID
IAO definition: The user-defined name for the sample.
linkml description: The user-defined name for the sample.
comments: Guidance: Every Sample ID from a single submitter must be unique. It can have any format, but we suggest that you make it concise, unique and consistent within your lab, and as informative as possible.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access

LABEL: third party lab service provider name
IAO definition: The name of the third party company or laboratory that provided services.
linkml description: The name of the third party company or laboratory that provided services.
comments: Guidance: Provide the full, unabbreviated name of the company or laboratory.
examples: third party lab service provider name example

LABEL: third party lab service provider name example
third party lab sample ID
IAO definition: The identifier assigned to a sample by a third party service provider.
linkml description: The identifier assigned to a sample by a third party service provider.
comments: Guidance: Store the sample identifier supplied by the third party services provider.
examples: third party lab sample ID example

LABEL: third party lab sample ID example

Type: DataHarmonizer field - database identifiers|DataHarmonizer field - host information
LABEL: case ID
IAO definition: The identifier used to specify an epidemiologically detected case of disease.
linkml description: The identifier used to specify an epidemiologically detected case of disease.
comments: Guidance: Provide the case identifer. The case ID greatly facilitates linkage between laboratory and epidemiological data. The case ID may be considered identifiable information. Consult the data steward before sharing.

LABEL: related specimen primary ID
IAO definition: The primary ID of a related specimen previously submitted to the repository.
linkml description: The primary ID of a related specimen previously submitted to the repository.
comments: Guidance: Store the primary ID of the related specimen previously submitted to the National Microbiology Laboratory so that the samples can be linked and tracked through the system.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access

LABEL: bioproject accession
IAO definition: The INSDC accession number of the BioProject(s) to which the BioSample belongs.
linkml description: The INSDC accession number of the BioProject(s) to which the BioSample belongs.
comments: Guidance: Required if submission is linked to a BioProject. BioProjects are an organizing tool that links together raw sequence data, assemblies, and their associated metadata. A valid BioProject accession has prefix PRJN, PRJE or PRJD, e.g., PRJNA12345 and is created once at the beginning of a new sequencing project. Your laboratory can have one or many BioProjects.

LABEL: biosample accession
IAO definition: The identifier assigned to a BioSample in INSDC archives.
linkml description: The identifier assigned to a BioSample in INSDC archives.
comments: Guidance: Store the accession returned from the BioSample submission. NCBI BioSamples will have the prefix SAMN, while ENA BioSamples will have the prefix SAMEA.

LABEL: GenBank/ENA/DDBJ accession
IAO definition: The GenBank/ENA/DDBJ identifier assigned to the sequence in the INSDC archives.
linkml description: The GenBank/ENA/DDBJ identifier assigned to the sequence in the INSDC archives.
comments: Guidance: Store the accession returned from a GenBank/ENA/DDBJ submission (viral genome assembly).

LABEL: GISAID accession
IAO definition: The GISAID accession number assigned to the sequence.
linkml description: The GISAID accession number assigned to the sequence.
comments: Guidance: Store the accession returned from the GISAID submission.

LABEL: GISAID virus name
IAO definition: The user-defined GISAID virus name assigned to the sequence.
linkml description: The user-defined GISAID virus name assigned to the sequence.
comments: Guidance: GISAID virus names should be in the format "hCoV-19/Country/Identifier/year".

LABEL: host specimen voucher
IAO definition: Identifier for the physical specimen.
linkml description: Identifier for the physical specimen.
comments: Guidance: Include a URI (Uniform Resource Identifier) in the form of a URL providing a direct link to the physical host specimen. If the specimen was destroyed in the process of analysis, electronic images (e-vouchers) are an adequate substitute for a physical host voucher specimen. If a URI is not available, a museum-provided globally unique identifier (GUID) can be used. If no persistent unique identifier is available, follow the INSDC guidance for populating the voucher_specimen attribute using standard triplets for institution codes (i.e., /specimen_voucher="[<institution-code>:[<collection-code>:]]<specimen_id>"): http://www.insdc.org/controlled-vocabulary-specimenvoucher-qualifier
example of usage: URI example: http://portal.vertnet.org/o/fmnh/mammals?id=33e55cfe-330b-40d9-aaae-8d042cba7542, INSDC triplet example: UAM:Mamm:52179

LABEL: host specimen voucher example
value: URI example: http://portal.vertnet.org/o/fmnh/mammals?id=33e55cfe-330b-40d9-aaae-8d042cba7542, INSDC triplet example: UAM:Mamm:52179

LABEL: IRIDA sample name
IAO definition: The identifier assigned to a sequenced isolate in IRIDA.
linkml description: The identifier assigned to a sequenced isolate in IRIDA.
comments: Guidance: Store the IRIDA sample name. The IRIDA sample name will be created by the individual entering data into the IRIDA platform. IRIDA samples may be linked to metadata and sequence data, or just metadata alone. It is recommended that the IRIDA sample name be the same as, or contain, the specimen collector sample ID for better traceability. It is also recommended that the IRIDA sample name mirror the GISAID accession. IRIDA sample names cannot contain slashes. Slashes should be replaced by underscores. See IRIDA documentation for more information regarding special characters (https://irida.corefacility.ca/documentation/user/user/samples/#adding-a-new-sample).

Issues / Notes: GENEPIO:0001125 - CanCOGeN only - Field removed after discussion between Emma and the NML (2021.12.17)

Alternative LABEL: NML submitted specimen primary ID example
Issues / Notes: GENEPIO:0001124 - CanCOGeN only - Field example removed after discussion between Emma and the NML (2021.12.17)

LABEL: SRA accession
IAO definition: The Sequence Read Archive (SRA), European Nucleotide Archive (ENA) or DDBJ Sequence Read Archive (DRA) identifier linking raw read data, methodological metadata and quality control metrics submitted to the INSDC.
linkml description: The Sequence Read Archive (SRA), European Nucleotide Archive (ENA) or DDBJ Sequence Read Archive (DRA) identifier linking raw read data, methodological metadata and quality control metrics submitted to the INSDC.
comments: Guidance: Store the accession assigned to the submitted "run". NCBI-SRA accessions start with SRR, EBI-ENA runs start with ERR and DRA accessions start with DRR.

LABEL: umbrella bioproject accession
IAO definition: The INSDC umbrella accession number of the BioProject to which the BioSample belongs.
linkml description: The INSDC umbrella accession number of the BioProject to which the BioSample belongs.
comments: Guidance: Required if submission is linked to an umbrella BioProject. An umbrella BioProject links together related BioProjects. A valid BioProject umbrella accession has prefix PRJN, PRJE or PRJD. Your laboratory can have one or many BioProjects.

Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
LABEL: sample collected by
IAO definition: The name of the agency that collected the original sample.
linkml description: The name of the agency that collected the original sample.
comments: Guidance: The name of the agency should be written out in full, (with minor exceptions) and be consistent across multiple submissions.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access

LABEL: sample collector contact email
IAO definition: The email address of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the sample.
linkml description: The email address of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the sample.
comments: Guidance: The email address can represent a specific individual or laboratory.

Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
LABEL: sample collector contact address
IAO definition: The mailing address of the agency submitting the sample.
linkml description: The mailing address of the agency submitting the sample.
comments: Guidance: The mailing address should be in the format: Street number and name, City, State/Province/Region, Country, Postal Code/Zip Code
example of usage: 655 Lab St, Vancouver, British Columbia, V5N 2A2, Canada

comments: Guidance: The name of the agency should be written out in full, (with minor exceptions) and be consistent across multiple submissions.
example of usage: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

linkml description: The email address of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the sequence.
comments: Guidance: The email address can represent a specific individual or laboratory.

LABEL: sequence submitter contact address
IAO definition: The mailing address of the agency submitting the sequence.

comments: Guidance: The mailing address should be in the format: Street number and name, City, State/Province/Region, Country, Postal Code/Zip Code

Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
LABEL: sample collection date
IAO definition: The date on which the sample was collected.
linkml description: The date on which the sample was collected.
comments: Guidance: Record the collection date accurately in the template. Required granularity includes year, month and day. Before sharing this data, ensure this date is not considered identifiable information. If this date is considered identifiable, it is acceptable to add "jitter" to the collection date by adding or subtracting calendar days. Do not change the collection date in your original records. Alternatively, ”received date” may be used as a substitute in the data you share. The date should be provided in ISO 8601 standard format \"YYYY-MM-DD".
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access

Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
LABEL: sample collection date precision
IAO definition: The precision to which the "sample collection date" was provided.
linkml description: The precision to which the "sample collection date" was provided.
comments: Guidance: Provide the precision of granularity to the "day", "month", or "year" for the date provided in the "sample collection date" field. The "sample collection date" will be truncated to the precision specified upon export; "day" for "YYYY-MM-DD", "month" for "YYYY-MM", or "year" for "YYYY".

Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
LABEL: sample received date
IAO definition: The date on which the sample was received.
linkml description: The date on which the sample was received.
comments: Guidance: The date the sample was received by a lab that was not the point of collection. ISO 8601 standard "YYYY-MM-DD".
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access

LABEL: geo_loc_name (country)

linkml description: The country of origin of the sample.
comments: Guidance: Provide the country name from the pick list in the template

Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
LABEL: geo_loc_name (state/province/territory)

linkml description: The state/province/territory of origin of the sample.
comments: Guidance: Provide the state/province/territory name from the GAZ geography ontology. Search for geography terms here: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/gaz

LABEL: geo_loc name (county/region)
IAO definition: The county/region of origin of the sample.
linkml description: The county/region of origin of the sample.
comments: Guidance: Provide the county/region name from the GAZ geography ontology. Search for geography terms here: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/gaz

Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
LABEL: geo_loc_name (city)
IAO definition: The city where the sample was collected.
linkml description: The city where the sample was collected.
comments: Guidance: Provide the city name. Use this look-up service to identify the standardized term: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/gaz

Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
LABEL: geo_loc latitude
IAO definition: The latitude coordinates of the geographical location of sample collection.
linkml description: The latitude coordinates of the geographical location of sample collection.
comments: Guidance: Provide latitude coordinates if available. Do not use the centre of the city/region/province/state/country or the location of your agency as a proxy, as this implicates a real location and is misleading. Specify as degrees latitude in format "d[d.dddd] N|S".

Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
LABEL: geo_loc longitude
IAO definition: The longitude coordinates of the geographical location of sample collection.
linkml description: The longitude coordinates of the geographical location of sample collection.
comments: Guidance: Provide longitude coordinates if available. Do not use the centre of the city/region/province/state/country or the location of your agency as a proxy, as this implicates a real location and is misleading. Specify as degrees longitude in format "d[dd.dddd] W|E".

Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
LABEL: organism
IAO definition: Taxonomic name of the organism.
linkml description: Taxonomic name of the organism.
comments: Guidance: Use "Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2". This value is provided in the template.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access

Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
LABEL: isolate
IAO definition: Identifier of the specific isolate.
linkml description: Identifier of the specific isolate.
comments: Guidance: This identifier should be an unique, indexed, alpha-numeric ID within your laboratory. If submitted to the INSDC, the "isolate" name is propagated throughtout different databases. As such, structure the "isolate" name to be ICTV/INSDC compliant in the following format: \"SARS-CoV-2/host/country/sampleID/date".
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access

Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
LABEL: culture collection
IAO definition: The name of the source collection and unique culture identifier.
linkml description: The name of the source collection and unique culture identifier.
comments: Guidance: Format: "<institution-code>:[<collection-code>:]<culture_id>". For more information, see http://www.insdc.org/controlled-vocabulary-culturecollection-qualifier.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access

Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
LABEL: purpose of sampling
IAO definition: The reason that the sample was collected.
linkml description: The reason that the sample was collected.
comments: Guidance: The reason a sample was collected may provide information about potential biases in sampling strategy. Provide the purpose of sampling from the picklist in the template. Most likely, the sample was collected for Diagnostic testing. The reason why a sample was originally collected may differ from the reason why it was selected for sequencing, which should be indicated in the "purpose of sequencing" field.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access

Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
LABEL: purpose of sampling details
IAO definition: The description of why the sample was collected, providing specific details.
linkml description: The description of why the sample was collected, providing specific details.
comments: Guidance: Provide an expanded description of why the sample was collected using free text. The description may include the importance of the sample for a particular public health investigation/surveillance activity/research question. If details are not available, provide a null value.
example of usage: Screening of bat specimens in museum collections.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access

comments: Guidance: Provide the name and version of the sample plan outlining the sample strategy.

Type: DataHarmonizer field - sample collection and processing
LABEL: sample collected in quarantine

linkml description: Whether the sample was collected from an individual in quarantine.
comments: Guidance: Whether a sample was collected under quarantine conditions (e.g. self-quarantining, medically isolated, staying at a quarantine hotel) can inform public health measure assessments. Use the picklist provided in the template.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access

comments: Guidance: This information is required for upload through the CNPHI LaSER system. Select the specimen type from the pick list provided. If sequence data is being submitted rather than a specimen for testing, select “Not Applicable”.

comments: Guidance: Provide the tag that describes how the previous sample is related to the current sample being submitted from the pick list provided, so that the samples can be linked and tracked in the system.

LABEL: host ethnicity
IAO definition: The self-identified ethnicity(ies) of the host.
linkml description: The self-identified ethnicity(ies) of the host.
comments: Guidance: If known, provide the self-identified ethnicity or ethnicities of the host as a free text description. This is highly sensitive information which must be treated respectfully and carefully when sharing. The information may have implications for equitable access and benefit sharing. Consult your privacy officer, data steward and/or cultural services representative.

LABEL: host subject ID
IAO definition: A unique identifier by which each host can be referred to e.g. #131
linkml description: A unique identifier by which each host can be referred to e.g. #131
comments: Guidance: Should be a unique, user-defined identifier. This ID can help link laboratory data with epidemiological data, however, is likely sensitive information. Consult the data steward.

LABEL: symptom onset date

linkml description: The date on which the symptoms began or were first noted.
comments: If known, provide the symptom onset date in ISO 8601 standard format "YYYY-MM-DD".

LABEL: signs and symptoms

linkml description: A perceived change in function or sensation, (loss, disturbance or appearance) indicative of a disease, reported by a patient.

purpose of sequencing
IAO definition: The reason that the sample was sequenced.
linkml description: The reason that the sample was sequenced.
comments: Guidance: The reason why a sample was originally collected may differ from the reason why it was selected for sequencing. The reason a sample was sequenced may provide information about potential biases in sequencing strategy. Provide the purpose of sequencing from the picklist in the template. The reason for sample collection should be indicated in the \"purpose of sampling\" field.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access

LABEL: purpose of sequencing details
IAO definition: The description of why the sample was sequenced providing specific details.
linkml description: The description of why the sample was sequenced providing specific details.
comments: Guidance: Provide an expanded description of why the sample was sequenced using free text. The description may include the importance of the sequences for a particular public health investigation/surveillance activity/research question. Suggested standardized descriotions include: Screened for S gene target failure (S dropout), Screened for mink variants, Screened for B.1.1.7 variant, Screened for B.1.135 variant, Screened for P.1 variant, Screened due to travel history, Screened due to close contact with infected individual, Assessing public health control measures, Determining early introductions and spread, Investigating airline-related exposures, Investigating temporary foreign worker, Investigating remote regions, Investigating health care workers, Investigating schools/universities, Investigating reinfection.
example of usage: Screened for S gene target failure (S dropout)
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access

LABEL: purpose of sampling details example
value: Screened for S gene target failure (S dropout)

linkml description: The date the sample was sequenced.
comments: Guidance: ISO 8601 standard "YYYY-MM-DD".
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access

LABEL: library ID
IAO definition: The user-specified identifier for the library prepared for sequencing.
linkml description: The user-specified identifier for the library prepared for sequencing.
comments: Guidance: The library name should be unique, and can be an autogenerated ID from your LIMS, or modification of the isolate ID.

LABEL: amplicon size
IAO definition: The length of the amplicon generated by PCR amplification.
linkml description: The length of the amplicon generated by PCR amplification.
comments: Guidance: Provide the amplicon size, including the units.

LABEL: library preparation kit
IAO definition: The name of the DNA library preparation kit used to generate the library being sequenced.
linkml description: The name of the DNA library preparation kit used to generate the library being sequenced.
comments: Guidance: Provide the name of the library preparation kit used.

LABEL: flow cell barcode
IAO definition: The barcode of the flow cell used for sequencing.
linkml description: The barcode of the flow cell used for sequencing.
comments: Guidance: Provide the barcode of the flow cell used for sequencing the sample.

LABEL: sequencing instrument
IAO definition: The model of the sequencing instrument used.
linkml description: The model of the sequencing instrument used.
comments: Guidance: Select a sequencing instrument from the picklist provided in the template.
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access

LABEL: sequencing protocol name
IAO definition: The name and version number of the sequencing protocol used.
linkml description: The name and version number of the sequencing protocol used.
comments: Guidance: Provide the name and version of the sequencing protocol.

LABEL: sequencing protocol
IAO definition: The protocol used to generate the sequence.
linkml description: The protocol used to generate the sequence.
comments: Guidance: Provide a free text description of the methods and materials used to generate the sequence. Suggested text, fill in information where indicated.: "Viral sequencing was performed following a tiling amplicon strategy using the <fill in> primer scheme. Sequencing was performed using a <fill in> sequencing instrument. Libraries were prepared using <fill in> library kit. "
example of usage: Genomes were generated through amplicon sequencing of 1200 bp amplicons with Freed schema primers. Libraries were created using Illumina DNA Prep kits, and sequence data was produced using Miseq Micro v2 (500 cycles) sequencing kits.

LABEL: sequencing protocol example
value: Genomes were generated through amplicon sequencing of 1200 bp amplicons with Freed schema primers. Libraries were created using Illumina DNA Prep kits, and sequence data was produced using Miseq Micro v2 (500 cycles) sequencing kits.

LABEL: sequencing kit number
IAO definition: The manufacturer's kit number.
linkml description: The manufacturer's kit number.
comments: Guidance: Alphanumeric value.

LABEL: amplicon pcr primer scheme
IAO definition: The specifications of the primers (primer sequences, binding positions, fragment size generated etc) used to generate the amplicons to be sequenced.
linkml description: The specifications of the primers (primer sequences, binding positions, fragment size generated etc) used to generate the amplicons to be sequenced.
comments: Guidance: Provide the name and version of the primer scheme used to generate the amplicons for sequencing.

LABEL: variant designation

If the lineage/clade contains mutations of concern (mutations that increase transmission, clincal severity, or other epidemiological fa ctors) but it not a global Variant of Concern, select Variant. If the lineage/clade does not contain mutations of concern, leave blank.

IAO definition: The name and version number of the protocol used for diagnostic marker amplification.
linkml description: The name and version number of the protocol used for diagnostic marker amplification.
comments: Guidance: The name and version number of the protocol used for carrying out a diagnostic PCR test. This information can be compared to sequence data for evaluation of performance and quality control.

LABEL: diagnostic pcr Ct value 1
IAO definition: The cycle threshold (Ct) value result from a diagnostic SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR test.
linkml description: The cycle threshold (Ct) value result from a diagnostic SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR test.
comments: Guidance: Provide the CT value of the sample from the diagnostic RT-PCR test.

LABEL: gene name 2
IAO definition: The name of the gene used in the diagnostic RT-PCR test.
linkml description: The name of the gene used in the diagnostic RT-PCR test.
comments: Guidance: Provide the full name of another gene used in an RT-PCR test. The gene symbol (short form of gene name) can also be provided. Standardized gene names and symbols can be found in the Gene Ontology using this look-up service: https://bit.ly/2Sq1LbI
data_collection_state: Not Applicable; Missing; Not Collected; Not Provided; Restricted Access

LABEL: diagnostic pcr protocol 2
IAO definition: The name and version number of the protocol used for diagnostic marker amplification.
linkml description: The name and version number of the protocol used for diagnostic marker amplification.
comments: Guidance: The name and version number of the protocol used for carrying out a second diagnostic PCR test. This information can be compared to sequence data for evaluation of performance and quality control.

LABEL: diagnostic pcr Ct value 2

linkml description: The cycle threshold (Ct) value result from a diagnostic SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR test.
comments: Guidance: Provide the CT value of the sample from the second diagnostic RT-PCR test.

LABEL: authors
IAO definition: Names of individuals contributing to the processes of sample collection, sequence generation, analysis, and data submission.
linkml description: Names of individuals contributing to the processes of sample collection, sequence generation, analysis, and data submission.
comments: Guidance: Include the first and last names of all individuals that should be attributed, separated by a comma.
example of usage: Tejinder Singh, Fei Hu, Joe Blogs

LABEL: authors example
value: Tejinder Singh, Fei Hu, Joe Blogs

LABEL: DataHarmonizer provenance
IAO definition: The DataHarmonizer software version provenance.
linkml description: The DataHarmonizer software version provenance.
comments: Guidance: The current software version information will be automatically generated in this field after the user utilizes the \"validate\" function. This information will be generated regardless as to whether the row is valid of not.
